verses.text: And the \sc Lord\sc* spake unto Moses, saying,

If a soul sin, and commit a trespass against the \sc Lord\sc*, and lie unto his neighbour in that which was delivered him to keep, or in fellowship, or in a thing taken away by violence, or hath deceived his neighbour;
or have found that which was lost, and lieth concerning it, and sweareth falsely; in any of all \add these\add* that a man doeth, sinning therein:

then it shall be, because he hath sinned, and is guilty, that he shall restore that which he took violently away, or the thing which he hath deceitfully gotten, or that which was delivered him to keep, or the lost \add thing\add* which he found,

or all \add that\add* about which he hath sworn falsely; he shall even restore it in the principal, and shall add the fifth \add part\add* more thereto, \add and\add* give it unto him to whom it appertaineth, in the day of his trespass offering.
And he shall bring his trespass offering unto the \sc Lord\sc*, a ram without blemish out of the flock, with thy estimation, for a trespass offering, unto the priest:
and the priest shall make an atonement for him before the \sc Lord\sc*: and it shall be forgiven him for any \add thing\add* of all that he hath done in trespassing therein.
And the \sc Lord\sc* spake unto Moses, saying,

Command Aaron and his sons, saying, This \add is\add* the law of the burnt offering: It \add is\add* the burnt offering, because of the burning upon the altar all night unto the morning, and the fire of the altar shall be burning in it.

And the priest shall put on his linen garment, and \add his\add* linen breeches shall he put upon his flesh, and take up the ashes which the fire hath consumed with the burnt offering on the altar, and he shall put them besides the altar.
And he shall put off his garments, and put on other garments, and carry forth the ashes without the camp unto a clean place.

And the fire upon the altar shall be burning in it; it shall not be put out: and the priest shall burn wood on it every morning, and lay the burnt offering in order upon it; and he shall burn thereon the fat of the peace offerings.
The fire shall ever be burning upon the altar; it shall never go out.
And this \add is\add* the law of the meat offering: the sons of Aaron shall offer it before the \sc Lord\sc*, before the altar.

And he shall take of it his handful, of the flour of the meat offering, and of the oil thereof, and all the frankincense which \add is\add* upon the meat offering, and shall burn \add it upon\add* the altar \add for\add* a sweet savour, \add even\add* the memorial of it, unto the \sc Lord\sc*.
And the remainder thereof shall Aaron and his sons eat: \add with\add* unleavened bread shall it be eaten in the holy place; in the court of the tabernacle of the congregation they shall eat it.

It shall not be baken \add with\add* leaven. I have given it \add unto them for\add* their portion of my offerings made by fire; it \add is\add* most holy, as \add is\add* the sin offering, and as the trespass offering.

All the males among the children of Aaron shall eat of it. \add It shall be\add* a statute for ever in your generations concerning the offerings of the \sc Lord\sc* made by fire: every one that toucheth them shall be holy.
And the \sc Lord\sc* spake unto Moses, saying,

This \add is\add* the offering of Aaron and of his sons, which they shall offer unto the \sc Lord\sc* in the day when he is anointed; the tenth \add part\add* of an ephah of fine flour \add for\add* a meat offering perpetual, half of it in the morning, and half thereof at night.

In a pan it shall be made with oil; \add and when it is\add* baken, thou shalt bring it in: \add and\add* the baken pieces of the meat offering shalt thou offer \add for\add* a sweet savour unto the \sc Lord\sc*.
And the priest of his sons that is anointed in his stead shall offer it: \add it is\add* a statute for ever unto the \sc Lord\sc*; it shall be wholly burnt.
For every meat offering for the priest shall be wholly \add burnt:\add* it shall not be eaten.
And the \sc Lord\sc* spake unto Moses, saying,

Speak unto Aaron and to his sons, saying, This \add is\add* the law of the sin offering: In the place where the burnt offering is killed shall the sin offering be killed before the \sc Lord\sc*: it \add is\add* most holy.
The priest that offereth it for sin shall eat it: in the holy place shall it be eaten, in the court of the tabernacle of the congregation.
Whatsoever shall touch the flesh thereof shall be holy: and when there is sprinkled of the blood thereof upon \add any\add* garment, thou shalt wash that whereon it was sprinkled in the holy place.
But the earthen vessel wherein it is sodden shall be broken: and if it be sodden in a brasen pot, it shall be both scoured, and rinsed in water.
All the males among the priests shall eat thereof: it \add is\add* most holy.

And no sin offering, whereof \add any\add* of the blood is brought into the tabernacle of the congregation to reconcile \add withal\add* in the holy \add place\add*, shall be eaten: it shall be burnt in the fire.
